intro: Isolepis curvifolia, commonly known as the curled spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense tufts at the base of the plant. Isolepis curvifolia plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
